moves.speaker: SPEAKER_1
moves.text: in metric scale and independent variables in any scale then we can run a regression. In regression there are two objectives one is to be able to predict your dependent variable and the other is to find out the drivers of the dependent variable. Now, in multiple linear regression we try to fit a line between the dependent variable and the independent variables.

utterances.speaker: SPEAKER_1
utterances.text: Hi guys. So, today we are going to be talking about this topic regression analysis and in this topic I am going to teach you the conceptual knowledge of regression. It is used as a multivariate analysis technique to study the interdependence between many variables. You need a dependent variable and you need many independent variables. For the dependent variable one of the prerequisite is that the dependent variable should have been captured in a metric scale. Does anyone remember what is metric scale? So, Nishant do you want to take that question?

utterances.speaker: SPEAKER_0
utterances.text: Yes sir. So, I believe that a variable which is taken into a interval or a ratio scale is being taken into a metric scale. Wonderful. So, dependent variable if it is

utterances.speaker: SPEAKER_1
utterances.text: So, we capture the historic data and we plot that historic data and we try and fit a best line with that plot. Can you guess how can we fit a best line best fit line? If this is the kind of distribution that you can see on the white board what do you think can be the logic to fit a best fit line there? Yes Tejaswini do you want to take that question?

utterances.speaker: SPEAKER_0
utterances.text: Yes sir. So, a line that passes through the maximum number of points can be the best fit

utterances.speaker: SPEAKER_1
utterances.text: lines. Yes that is one logic and I like your answer except that Tejaswini if you look at the maximum number of points it may so happen that we may not get a unique solution. We may get two lines that passes through maximum number of points or maybe 3, 4, 5 in which case you know finding the best fit line would become a challenge. Class do you have any alternate solution to figuring out how given this distribution of points we can find a best fit line? Yes Nishant what are your thoughts on this?

utterances.speaker: SPEAKER_0
utterances.text: So, sir I was thinking about a line that splits the point into equal counts on either half the same number of points on the left and the right side of the line.

utterances.speaker: SPEAKER_1
utterances.text: Yes. So, that is also possible we can have points which are equally distributed on either side of the line, but then again Nishant the same issue remains we may not get a unique solution. In fact, I can show you a line multiple lines that split the points into multiple into equal halves, but then they are not the best fit line clearly not the best fit line.

utterances.speaker: SPEAKER_1
utterances.text: So, in this case we will have to think deeper and find out what can be the solution and how can be a generic algorithm be found that can have that can give us the best fit line given this distribution of points. I would urge the class to think a little deeper and think about an alternate solution. Yes Tejaswini you are raising your hand.

utterances.speaker: SPEAKER_0
utterances.text: Sir, how about a line that has minimum distance from all the points?

utterances.speaker: SPEAKER_1
utterances.text: Yes, that can be a good way to figure out the best fit line, but by the way there is a technical word for this distance can you tell me Nishant what is this distance between any point and a corresponding point on the line. So, a distance between the actual y

utterances.speaker: SPEAKER_0
utterances.text: value and the predicted y value. Sir, is it called the error or the residual?

utterances.speaker: SPEAKER_1
utterances.text: So, exactly that is called residual or the error. So, we are talking about a line that minimizes the error in y and I think that can be a good way to figure out the best fit line. So, we are talking about a line that has the least error from all the points and we find out the error for each point we square the error and we sum it up and the line that has these the least sum square of errors is called our best fit line and this algorithm is called the ordinary least square algorithm and it is used to fit the best fit line in case of a multiple linear regression. So, class now we understand an algorithm that can be used to fit a best fit line in case of multivariate scenario where we are trying to study the relationship of dependence using regression.

observe_context: 1 move • “What do we notice?” Highlight concrete evidence before moving forward.
hypothesis_context: 4 moves • “What could explain the observation?” Encourage learners to voice emerging theories.
challenge_context: 1 move • “Does this hypothesis hold up?” Invite critique and stress-testing of ideas.
resolution_context: 2 moves • “What have we learned?” Synthesize takeaways and close the loop together.
